Get List Item Count: You can use this action to find out how many entries there are in a list. You supply the variable that holds the list index (as returned by the action Create List) and the target variable to store the returned number of items in the list (which can be flagged as a temporary local variable to be used until the end of the script or event).
The index (stored in a variable) to get the item count from
The target variable to store the returned item count

The above action block code gets the size of the list referenced in the global variable and then uses a for loop to loop through it and destroy the instances with the IDs stored in the list. After the loop is finished, the list is freed from memory.
